pullRequest.body:
Adding equivalence between OnePoint K and projective line over K, as discussed at https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.E2.9C.94.20Projective.20extended.20real.20line/near/463620378

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f5f239fafd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16152/commits/f5f239fafd2d7b303b960b65b683343110db436d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Compactification.OnePointEquiv`|1212|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ divOnePoint`
`+ divOnePoint'`
`+ divOnePoint_lifts`
`+ divSlope`
`+ divSlope_equiv`
`+ divSlope_inj_lifted`
`+ divSlope_injective`
`+ divSlope_inv`
`+ divSlope_surjective`
`+ instance [DivisionRing K] : Setoid ({v : Fin 2 → K // v ≠ 0})`
`+ not_both_zero`
`+ slope_inv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks for separating out the other changes from #16128. Does this take all comments from that PR into account?
If so, please
- adjust the PR title and description to match that PR,
- feel free to close the other PR, and
- remove the awaiting-author label from this PR.
Thanks!

Yes, I believe this is ready to continue with (and continue discussion
etc.). I've made those adjustments now. Thanks!

On Mon, Aug 26, 2024 at 2:20 AM grunweg ***@***.***> wrote:

> Thanks for separating out the other changes from #16128
> <https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16128__;!!PvDODwlR4mBZyAb0!TJsYmjHC4O6pyegMNyZuzg0Iyk5bPqVPGQpHG_SVqArtebUfYnREAFYDjX_nQGdGY0Fh31XiQkfl_THQmCaZg443XPI$>.
> Does this take all comments from that PR into account?
> If so, please
>
>    - adjust the PR title and description to match that PR,
>    - feel free to close the other PR, and
>    - remove the awaiting-author label from this PR.
>    Thanks!
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16152*issuecomment-2310074231__;Iw!!PvDODwlR4mBZyAb0!TJsYmjHC4O6pyegMNyZuzg0Iyk5bPqVPGQpHG_SVqArtebUfYnREAFYDjX_nQGdGY0Fh31XiQkfl_THQmCaZw8_tJMU$>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AANI37SLWBIYNWPWU7VTYQDZTMMRVAVCNFSM6AAAAABNDNIQWOVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMZDGMJQGA3TIMRTGE__;!!PvDODwlR4mBZyAb0!TJsYmjHC4O6pyegMNyZuzg0Iyk5bPqVPGQpHG_SVqArtebUfYnREAFYDjX_nQGdGY0Fh31XiQkfl_THQmCaZkHiOvPU$>
> .
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>


-- 
With best regards,
Bjørn Kjos-Hanssen <https://math.hawaii.edu/wordpress/bjoern/> | Professor,
Mathematics | University of Hawaii at Manoa
Closing this due to the "unable to automatically merge".
Thanks, done. I also made it `variable {K : Type*}` now (after realizing that that needs to be in `{ }` not `( )` brackets).

pullRequest.title: feat: equivalence between one-point compactification and projective line
